maml:description.maml:para: Adds tag to a specific Machine.
Adds tag to a specific Machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-MdeMachineTag -id '123' -tag 'Tag-1'

maml:description.maml:para: Clears the authorization information that is used to get a valid MDE token.
Clears the authorization information that is used to get a valid MDE token.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Clear-MdeAuthorizationInfo

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the authorization information that is used to get a valid MDE token.

Returns the authorization information that is used to get a valid MDE token including current token expiration state and current token roles. To clear, please use the Clear-MdeAuthorizationInfo function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-MdeAuthorizationInfo

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or multiple machine objects
If no parameters are specified, returns all Defender for Endpoint machines. If an ID is specified, it returns a single machine object, if the ID is found, otherwise nothing.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $machines = Get-MdeMachine

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $machine = Get-MdeMachine -id '123'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or multiple machine objects by OData filter

Returns all Defender for Endpoint machines that matches the filter. For details, refer to the \ OData docs article\ (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/defender-endpoint/exposed-apis-odata-samples?view=o365-worldwide)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $machines = Get-MdeMachineByFilter -filter 'lastSeen gt 2018-08-01Z'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $machines = Get-MdeMachineByFilter -filter "startswith(computerDnsName,'mymachine')"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $machines = Get-MdeMachineByFilter -filter "healthStatus eq 'Active'"

maml:description.maml:para: List roles for a given function.
Lists required roles and current token roles for a specific function from this module.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-MdeRoles -functionName 'Get-MdeMachine'

maml:description.maml:para: A short one-line action-based description, e.g. 'Tests if a function is valid'
A longer description of the function, its purpose, common use cases, etc.
Specifies the severity, can be "Low", "Medium", "High" or "Critical".
Specifies the severity, can be "Low", "Medium", "High" or "Critical".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test-MyTestFunction -Verbose Explanation of the function or its result. You can include multiple examples with additional .EXAMPLE lines
